opensensorsdata

shape data to shape society

In the digital era information is power. Without access to data there is no reliable public information, and so no power for people. We are an internet startup committed to provide open access to world data and tools to combine, compare and shape to create meaningful information. Our goal is to empower people to shape society by shaping data, brick after brick

access to data

build data into bricks

share and reuse your bricks

manifesto

Internet is a natural resource. But unlikely other natural resources, Internet is not a thing, is an agreement on how different networks can work together. Because of this, it doesn’t belong to anyone in particular; rather, we hold the internet in common. For those who agree, Internet is a public good – everyone can use it and improve it – but the key value of the net is not built-in in its architecture. Internet is not optimised for specific purposes; in itself, internet is stupid – does nothing more than moving bits. Rather its key value is at its ends, not at its center. Counting on the internet, everyone at each edge can offer services built on top of it. Counting on the open, unowned agreement upon which the Internet is based, everyone at each edge can share data. As such, the Internet enable a free market of innovation, where people with business ideas are not just free to engage with a marketplace, they create a marketplace though conversations and connections. Edges are not points at which the internet ends, but where its value begin to be exploited. We are among those edges. We are an Internet startup. That’s our posit.

Internet Companies are defined by what they own and see market as their target. We don’t. We believe this approach to be stupid, in a bad sense; a fundamental misunderstanding of internet enabled innovation which is, at first, business and social innovation. We don’t target our market, we discuss with it: values, practices and a genuine points of view. There are no barbed wire fences between us and our customers; and will never be. If companies’ culture stop where community begins, then there is no market to innovate but just profit to make. Building fences might foster your business, for a while. But innovation is not about making “the Big Money”, is about growing values at the edge of the net: strengthening connections and building conversations between already existing markets. The innovation we hunt for is a collective pursuing of opportunities by informed citizens, customers and business people, as we are. It’s a long run. That’s what radical changes require.

This open marketplace we like much better and this is what we are committed to: improve open business in a networked market. Networked market concerns are people concerns. Every new connection in the marketplace is an expression of interest and every new conversation between two edges requires a value agreement. Sharing, in this market, requires protocols too. No fences does not mean no rules, just new methods. We promote open access to information, but we don’t believe openess of information to be the only component for empowering people –being them citizen, government, customers or entrepreneurs. We, rather, believe that values lies at the bottom of data production, in the capabilities of knowledge workers. Open Business is fundamentally about operating in a net where not all the coolest people work for you and no one possess all the data. We work by exploring new form of business organization and open business models; we deploy new methods to capture value systematically and radical tactics to curb new powerful form of knowledge exchange and re-use.

We are civic entrepreneurs, that’s our values and our protocols. Will you join the party?
